title: 220Fps -> 7Fps
body:
I normally ran ultra settings and got 220fps I set it to the lowest settings and got 60fps max so I kept it on ultra since the settings don't change my fps.

I read and did everything on the [Fps Troubleshooting list](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-troubleshooting#section-windows)

I took a screen and right after it dropped to 7fps for a few mins then went back to a max of 60fps with constant drops to 30 or even 20.

http://i.imgur.com/lfjdLdh.jpg
^37fps dropped to 7fps for a few minutes after.

I have 6gb ram and a computer that can run Titanfall 2 on pretty high settings.

replies.body: It sounds strange that your frames are still dropping, especially after going through the guide.  Out of curiosity what video card are you using, and is it on a plugged in laptop or desktop pc?  We'd like to take a closer look individually and help, so hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).   Download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) as well to automatically obtain some logs for context, and attach it to the ticket.  We'll reply back a soon as possible.

I have a 2011 Asus Gaming laptop that runs games like GTA 5 and Titanfall 2 with pretty good fps.

https://www.asus.com/ca-en/Notebooks/ROG-G73Jh/

The video card is Radeon HD 5800 Series (mobile version)

I upgraded the Hdd to solid state a few years ago and upgraded the screen also the cpu from like 720 to i7 q840 but it is basically unplayable atm adjusting the graphics does not change the fps or ping at all. Team fights are a GGEZ moment lol

Ok thanks I ran hex tech and completely reinstallledand cleaned ran CCleaner as I always do and still can't get more than 100 which is half what I normally got but still playable even if it drops to 30 once a game. I will fill a ticket in a bit thanks!
